author: wired blogs
text: date: tue 11/02/1999 5:11 am from: adrian hempel (athempel@ozemail.com.au)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: "vote in your underwear"voting over the web? are these people serious? ("vote in your underwear ," 2.nov.1999). the proposal frightens me. to allow voting over the internet is to allow an electoral process that is firmly biased towards high-income, well-educated voters who have internet access at home or work. you will be making it significantly easier for them to vote. their participation will increase substantially, while that of the rest of the population will be unaffected. have we forgotten all about equity in our race to wire the planet?
